name: RENDER__LIST_WORKSPACES
description: List all workspaces that you have access to in your Render account.

name: RENDER__GET_WORKSPACE
description: Retrieve details of a specific workspace by its owner ID.

ownerId.description: The ID of the workspace/owner to retrieve.

name: RENDER__LIST_WORKSPACE_MEMBERS
description: Retrieves the list of users belonging to the workspace with the provided ID.

ownerId.description: The ID of the team/workspace to list members for.

name: RENDER__LIST_SERVICES
description: List all services in the current workspace. Returns a paginated list of services you have access to.

limit.description: Number of services to return per page.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination to get the next page of results.

name: RENDER__GET_SERVICE
description: Retrieve details about a specific service by its ID.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to retrieve details for.

name: RENDER__LIST_ENV_VARS
description: List all environment variables for a specific service.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to list environment variables for.

name: RENDER__UPDATE_ENV_VARS
description: Update multiple environment variables for a service. This replaces all environment variables.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to update environment variables for.

body.description: Array of environment variables to set

name: RENDER__GET_ENV_VAR
description: Retrieve a specific environment variable by key for a service.

key.description: The environment variable key to retrieve.

name: RENDER__SET_ENV_VAR
description: Add or update a single environment variable for a service.

key.description: The environment variable key to set.

name: RENDER__DELETE_ENV_VAR
description: Delete a specific environment variable by key for a service.

key.description: The environment variable key to delete.

name: RENDER__CREATE_WEB_SERVICE
description: Create a new web service with specified configuration including repository, build settings, and environment variables.

type.description: The type of service to create.

ownerId.description: The ID of the owner/workspace for this service.

branch.description: The Git branch to deploy from.

rootDir.description: The root directory of the service in the repository.

env.description: The runtime environment for the service.

buildCommand.description: The command to build the service.

startCommand.description: The command to start the service.

region.description: The region to deploy the service.

name: RENDER__CREATE_STATIC_SITE
description: Create a new static site with specified configuration including repository, build settings, and custom domains.

type.description: The type of service to create.

name.description: The name of the static site.

ownerId.description: The ID of the owner/workspace for this site.

repo.description: The Git repository URL (e.g., https://github.com/user/repo). Do not include the branch in the repo string.

branch.description: The Git branch to deploy from. If left empty, this will fall back to the default branch of the repository.

image.description: Image configuration for the static site.

rootDir.description: The root directory of the site in the repository.

envVars.description: Environment variables for the build process

environmentId.description: The ID of the environment the service is associated with.

buildCommand.description: The command to build the static site.

headers.description: Custom headers for the static site

publishPath.description: The directory containing the built static files to serve. Defaults to 'public'.

pullRequestPreviewsEnabled.description: Whether to enable pull request previews. DEPRECATED: This field has been deprecated. previews.generation should be used in its place.

routes.description: Route configuration for the static site

renderSubdomainPolicy.description: Controls whether render.com subdomains are available for the service.

name: RENDER__SUSPEND_SERVICE
description: Suspend a running service to stop it from consuming resources. The service can be resumed later.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to suspend.

name: RENDER__RESUME_SERVICE
description: Resume a suspended service to restore it to running state.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to resume.

name: RENDER__RESTART_SERVICE
description: Restart a service to reload its configuration and redeploy the latest code.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to restart.

name: RENDER__LIST_DEPLOYS
description: List all deployments for a specific service, including their status and deployment details.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to list deployments for.

limit.description: Number of deployments to return per page.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination to get the next page of results.

name: RENDER__TRIGGER_DEPLOY
description: Trigger a new deployment for a service to deploy the latest code from the connected repository.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to trigger deployment for.

name: RENDER__GET_DEPLOY
description: Retrieve details about a specific deployment, including its status, logs, and deployment information.

deployId.description: The ID of the deployment to retrieve.

name: RENDER__CANCEL_DEPLOY
description: Cancel a running deployment to stop the deployment process.

deployId.description: The ID of the deployment to cancel.

name: RENDER__ROLLBACK_DEPLOY
description: Roll back to a previous deployment to restore the service to a previous working state.

deployId.description: The ID of the deployment to roll back to.

name: RENDER__LIST_POSTGRES_INSTANCES
description: List all Postgres database instances in your account with their configuration and status.

limit.description: Number of instances to return per page.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination to get the next page of results.

name: RENDER__CREATE_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Create a new Postgres database instance with specified configuration including plan, region, and initial settings.

name.description: The name of the Postgres instance.

ownerId.description: The ID of the owner/workspace for this instance.

region.description: The region to deploy the Postgres instance.

name: RENDER__GET_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Retrieve details about a specific Postgres instance including configuration, status, and connection information.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance to retrieve.

name: RENDER__UPDATE_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Update configuration of an existing Postgres instance such as plan, auto-suspend settings, or other parameters.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance to update.

plan.description: The Postgres plan/tier to update to.

autoSuspend.description: Whether to enable auto-suspend for the instance.

name: RENDER__GET_POSTGRES_CONNECTION_INFO
description: Retrieve connection information for a Postgres instance including host, port, database name, and credentials.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance.

name: RENDER__SUSPEND_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Suspend a Postgres instance to stop it from consuming resources while preserving data.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance to suspend.

name: RENDER__RESUME_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Resume a suspended Postgres instance to restore it to active state.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance to resume.

name: RENDER__RESTART_POSTGRES_INSTANCE
description: Restart a Postgres instance to reload configuration and apply any pending changes.

postgresId.description: The ID of the Postgres instance to restart.

name: RENDER__LIST_LOGS
description: List logs matching the provided filters. Logs are paginated by start and end timestamps.

ownerId.description: The ID of the workspace to return logs for.

startTime.description: Epoch/Unix timestamp of start of time range to return. Defaults to now() - 1 hour.

endTime.description: Epoch/Unix timestamp of end of time range to return. Defaults to now().

direction.description: The direction to query logs for. Backward will return most recent logs first.

resource.description: Filter logs by their resource. A resource is the id of a server, cronjob, job, postgres, or redis.

instance.description: Filter logs by the instance they were emitted from.

host.description: Filter request logs by their host. Wildcards and regex are supported.

statusCode.description: Filter request logs by their status code. Wildcards and regex are supported.

method.description: Filter request logs by their requests method. Wildcards and regex are supported.

level.description: Filter logs by their severity level. Wildcards and regex are supported.

type.description: Filter logs by their type. Types include app, request, and build logs.

text.description: Filter by the text of the logs. Wildcards and regex are supported.

path.description: Filter request logs by their path. Wildcards and regex are supported.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return.

name: RENDER__LIST_LOG_LABEL_VALUES
description: List all values for a given log label in the logs matching the provided filters.

ownerId.description: The ID of the workspace to return log label values for.

label.description: The label to query logs for.

startTime.description: Epoch/Unix timestamp of start of time range to return. Defaults to now() - 1 hour.

endTime.description: Epoch/Unix timestamp of end of time range to return. Defaults to now().

direction.description: The direction to query logs for. Backward will return most recent logs first.

resource.description: Filter logs by their resource. A resource is the id of a server, cronjob, job, postgres, or redis.

instance.description: Filter logs by the instance they were emitted from.

host.description: Filter request logs by their host. Wildcards and regex are supported.

statusCode.description: Filter request logs by their status code. Wildcards and regex are supported.

method.description: Filter request logs by their requests method. Wildcards and regex are supported.

level.description: Filter logs by their severity level. Wildcards and regex are supported.

type.description: Filter logs by their type. Types include app, request, and build logs.

text.description: Filter by the text of the logs. Wildcards and regex are supported.

path.description: Filter request logs by their path. Wildcards and regex are supported.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return.

name: RENDER__LIST_KEY_VALUE_INSTANCES
description: List all Key Value instances in your Render account.

ownerId.description: The ID of the workspace to list Key Value instances for.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor for retrieving next set of instances.

name: RENDER__GET_KEY_VALUE_INSTANCE
description: Get details about a specific Key Value instance.

keyValueId.description: The ID of the Key Value instance to retrieve.

name: RENDER__CREATE_KEY_VALUE_INSTANCE
description: Create a new Key Value instance.

name.description: The name of the Key Value instance.

ownerId.description: The ID of the workspace that will own this Key Value instance.

region.description: The region where the Key Value instance will be created.

name: RENDER__UPDATE_SERVICE
description: Update configuration of an existing web service including build commands, start commands, and environment settings.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service to update.

buildCommand.description: The command to build the service.

startCommand.description: The command to start the service.

region.description: The region to deploy the service.
